info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 9:52PM CDT until July 3 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...
White River At Clarendon affecting Monroe and Arkansas Counties.
White River At Augusta affecting Woodruff and White Counties.
Black River At Black Rock affecting Independence, Jackson and Lawrence Counties.
For the Lower White River...including Newport, Augusta, Georgetown, Des Arc, Clarendon...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Corning, Pocahontas, Black Rock... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Black River at Black Rock.
* WHEN...Until Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Farm ground along east bank begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 1000 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Independence, AR; Jackson, AR; Lawrence, AR
